::::{.columns}

:::{.column}
Select block

```{mermaid}
%%| fig-width: 2
flowchart TD
  data_in(Data input)
  data_out(Transformed data)
  subgraph block
    select_col[Select column]
  end
  data_in --> block --> data_out
```

:::

:::{.column}
Filter block

```{mermaid}
%%| fig-width: 2
flowchart TD
  data_in(Data input)
  data_out(Transformed data)
  subgraph block
    select_col[Select columns] --> filter_func[Filter function ==, !=] --> filter_val[Filter values]
  end
  data_in --> block --> data_out
```

## The stack: data analysis recipe ðŸ“œ

::::{.columns}

:::{.column}
![](assets/img/undraw_diet_ghvw.svg)
:::

:::{.column}
Collection of instructions to go from __data import__ to __wrangling__ (and optionally visualisation)

```{mermaid}
%%| fig-width: 6
flowchart LR
  subgraph stack
    direction TB
    input_1(Data);
    transform_1(Transform);
    output_1(Visualize);
    input_1 --> transform_1 --> output_1;
  end
  stack --> stack2
  subgraph stack2
    direction TB
    input_2(Data);
    transform_2(Transform);
    output_2(Visualize);
    input_2 --> transform_2 --> output_2;
  end
```
:::

## blockr demo

```{shinylive-r}
#| standalone: true
#| components: [viewer]
#| viewerHeight: 800
## file: app.R
webr::install("blockr", repos = "https://blockr-org.github.io/webr-repos")
webr::install("blockr.data", repos = "https://blockr-org.github.io/webr-repos")

library(blockr)

stack <- new_stack(filesbrowser_block, csv_block, select_block)
serve_stack(stack)
```
